reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly states that personal data is collected directly from users, automatically through tracking technologies, and from third parties. The app clearly declares the collection of data.
reply.reference: We collect personal data about you from the following sources: Directly from you. For example, we may collect personal data from you when you contact us through the Platform or communicate with us. Automatically and through tracking technologies. For example, we may automatically collect information or inferences about you, such as through cookies and other tracking technologies, when you interact with the Platform. From third parties. We may collect personal data from third parties, such as service and content providers, business partners, social media companies, or other parties who interact with us. URL: https://www.jiminihealth.com/privacy-policy

This Privacy Policy explains how we process personal data collected through the Jimini Health website and mobile application available in the app stores (together, the “Platform”) as well as all relevant content and functionality associated with the Platform.

10. California Shine the Light
If you are a California resident, you may opt out of sharing your personal data subject to California Civil Code §1798.83 (the “Shine the Light law”) with third parties for those third parties’ direct marketing purposes by emailing us at support@jiminihealth.com.

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects identifiers, demographic information, commercial information, internet or other electronic network activity information, non-precise geolocation data, inferences, and sensitive personal data.

content: Internet or electronic network activity information (e.g., browsing history)

reply.analysis: The privacy policy document clearly states the various types of personal data collected by the app. These include identifiers, demographic information, commercial information, internet activity details, geolocation data, inferences, and sensitive personal data.
reply.reference: personal data we may collect - Identifiers, demographic information, commercial information, internet or other electronic network activity information, non-precise geolocation data, inferences, sensitive personal data. URL: https://www.jiminihealth.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states the various purposes for which personal data is collected, used, and shared by the app.
reply.reference: We may use personal data for the following purposes: To provide the Platform to you; To manage and improve the Platform, including the development of additional functionality; To support machine learning model training and analytics; To analyze how the Platform is being used so we can improve the Platform and the user experience; To evaluate the success of our marketing campaigns; To manage payment processing; To evaluate and control quality of the Platform, identify usage trends, and improve your user experience; To find and prevent fraud, and keep the Platform safe and secure; To send you information about changes to our terms, conditions, and policies; To conduct research and analysis internally and with approved research partners, using your information; To report permissive reporting of expressed threats of violence towards an ascertainable victim; To allow us to pursue available remedies or limit the damages that we may sustain; and For other purposes for which we provide specific notice at the time the information is collected. URL: https://www.jiminihealth.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection by emailing support@jiminihealth.com. However, deleting data may be challenging or impossible due to the need to back up systems and legal retention requirements.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions that users can opt out of sharing personal data for marketing purposes by emailing support@jiminihealth.com. However, complete deletion of data may be hindered by system backups and legal obligations to retain data.
reply.reference: If you are a California resident, you may opt out of sharing your personal data subject to California Civil Code §1798.83 (the “Shine the Light law”) with third parties for those third parties’ direct marketing purposes by emailing us at support@jiminihealth.com. While we will use reasonable efforts to remove your personal data, the need to back up our systems to protect information from inadvertent loss means a copy of your personal data may exist in a non-erasable form that will be difficult or impossible for us to locate or remove. We may also need to retain personal data as required by law. URL: https://www.jiminihealth.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties under specific circumstances.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions several situations in which the app shares data with third parties such as Advisors, government and law enforcement authorities, third parties upon user direction or consent, and in business transfers.
reply.reference: The app may share personal data with Advisors, third parties upon user direction or consent, and in business transfers. URL: https://www.jiminihealth.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with Advisors, third parties upon user direction or consent, third parties pursuant to business transfers, and government and law enforcement authorities.

content: third parties upon user direction or consent
third parties pursuant to business transfers
